documents.title: two women in their 80s killed in yorkshire dales crash
text: police have confirmed two pensioners have died after their car crashed into a tree near settle in north yorkshire .
it happened on the a65 near austwick on saturday .
the driver , an 87-year-old woman from morley , leeds , sustained serious injuries and was taken by air ambulance to preston hospital , where she later died .
the passenger , an 89-year-old woman , also from morley died at the scene .

documents.title: football : man city defender john stones 'out for six weeks '
text: manchester city defender john stones could be out for up to six weeks after apparently injuring his hamstring during saturday 's victory at leicester .
stones , 23 , pulled up and grasped the back of his leg before being replaced in the 31st minute of city 's 2-0 win at the king power stadium .
city boss pep guardiola confirmed after the game that the centre-back is likely to be sidelined for a month and a half .
`` it is tough because the calendar is so demanding , '' said guardiola .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: man charged after alleged siege in bolton
text: a man has been charged in connection with an alleged siege in bolton .
police were called to a property in bolton at about 03:00 on saturday after reports a man had locked himself inside the building .
martin wright , 29 , from bolton , has been charged with affray and common assault and will appear at salford and manchester magistrates ' court later .

documents.title: bus drivers staging fourth dispute over pay offer
text: drivers at arriva north west are staging the latest in a series of strikes over pay .
services across greater manchester , merseyside and cheshire are being affected by the fourth of five planned walkouts this month .
workers will be balloted this week on an initial 2.6 % pay offer , rising to 3 % .
but unions are recommending the offer should be rejected .
a further nine days of action are scheduled for december .

documents.title: mayor 's plan to regenerate 'left-behind ' town centres
text: greater manchester mayor andy burnham has launched a plan to transform `` left-behind '' town centres in the region .
he said it was part of the rewrite of a controversial housing strategy , which had included plans to build on the area 's green belt land .
the `` town centre challenge '' would instead target building on derelict `` brownfield '' land , he said .
all 10 boroughs in the region are invited to nominate a town for the scheme before the new year .

the rain will turn increasingly patchy through the afternoon but the skies will remain overcast for most .

documents.title: bus strikes set to affect services next month
text: bus services in south cheshire are likely to be affected by further strikes involving arriva north west workers next month .
members of the unite and gmb unions are due to take nine days of industrial action , after calling the latest pay offer from managers `` insulting '' .
they plan to walk out on 4 , 7 , 12 , 13 , 14 , 20 , 21 , 22 and 23 december and already had strikes planned for the next two mondays .
arriva earlier this week said it was `` keen '' to meet the unions and `` resolve the pay dispute '' .

documents.title: restored 1980s police cars visit former home
text: two vintage police cars have returned to their former home at smithdown lane police station in liverpool after being restored .
the vintage ford escort rs2000s , owned by merseyside police in the 1980s , have been refurbished by ex-police officers .
one of the cars belonged to ex-humberside police officer graham carter , who bought it at auction back in early 2015 for £ 14,000 .
he has since spent the past two years and around £ 2,500 restoring it .
the second was restored by ex-greater manchester police traffic officer sean white who is now a pilot with etihad airways .

the return of the cars was a great opportunity for some merseyside police nostalgia , especially for the for roads policing department who thoroughly enjoyed comparing the cars with the vehicles they use today- and there 's definitely plenty to compare .

documents.title: bus drivers claim pay-rise 'insult ' works out at 1p per hour
text: bus drivers at the centre of a pay rise row with arriva have claimed the company 's latest offer amounts to just 1p per hour more than the previous offer .
drivers across the north west recently announced a further nine days of strike action , and had already planned to walk out on monday .
on friday talks between the bus operator and the unite and gmb unions collapsed after their `` final '' offer of 2.6 % from april to october and then 3 % from october to next april .
regional officer john boughton said : `` the highest paid director in arriva north west has more put into his pension each year than the average pay of a bus worker in the north west .
`` this company makes huge profits .
all our members want is a fair share . ''
the offer was insulting and very demeaning from a company with huge financial resources .

documents.title: football : this weekend 's top north west fixtures
text: it 's a busy weekend for the north west 's premier league teams with all of them in action on saturday .

in the 15:00 kick-offs , burnley host struggling swansea city at turf moor ; everton face bottom-of-the-league crystal palace ; league leaders manchester city take on leicester city at the king power stadium and fifth-placed liverpool welcome southampton to anfield .
manchester united play newcastle in the late kick-off , with zlatan ibrahimovic and paul pogba both returning from injury .

documents.title: liverpool to take back control of roads maintenance
text: liverpool city council is to bring the city 's roads maintenance back under its own control by ending an agreement with an outsourcing provider early .
the council is looking to end a nine-year contract with amey , which began in july 2013 , by the end of january .
the council said the contract initially made cost savings but further savings could be made in-house .
it follows services such as street cleaning , it and payroll being brought back in-house in the city .
the services provided by amey including highway maintenance , street lighting and winter maintenance
the plans will be discussed by the council 's cabinet next friday .

documents.title: bowls player left needing plastic surgery after attack by teens
text: a man playing bowls with a friend in a park was left needing plastic surgery after he was hit over the head by a group of teenagers in an apparently unprovoked attack .
the 26-year-old victim was in hyde park , tameside , when he was at first verbally abused by the group on 2 november .
the two men attempted to leave the park in their car but were surrounded .
one hit the car with a wooden stick while another struck the victim over the head with a large stick .
the man was taken to hospital where he was treated for head injuries which required plastic surgery .
greater manchester police are appealing for anyone with information to contact the force .
det con wayne marshall said : this was a shocking attack on two innocent men who were minding their own business and enjoying their afternoon in the park .
the men sensed trouble when they were first approached and tried to leave but the group were determined to harm them in some way and i am appalled by their behaviour . ''

documents.title: teenagers stabbed and attacked with baseball bats
text: two teenagers were attacked by a group of masked men wielding knives , bricks and baseball bats in manchester , leaving one of the boys with stab injuries .
the pair , aged 16 and 17 , were attacked in spender avenue , cheetham hill , at about 22:00 on thursday .
the 16-year-old was stabbed several times in his shoulders , body and legs while the 17-year-old was repeatedly hit with a brick and a baseball bat .
the men , who had their faces covered , then fled and the victims were taken to hospital .
police are asking anyone with information to contact them .

documents.title: rare amphibian born at chester zoo
text: chester zoo has bred one of europe 's rarest amphibians for the first time .
twelve montseny newts , among the most endangered species of newt , have hatched after the zoo created a purpose-built breeding area .
they will eventually be reintroduced to mountains outside barcelona - the amphibians ' only habitat - to help boost numbers .

documents.title: arriva makes 'final pay offer ' to striking bus drivers
text: arriva says it has made a final pay offer to its striking bus drivers after talks with the unite union aimed at averting further strike action on services across the north west .
but union members have said they wo n't recommend it to their members and will instead have a fresh vote on the offer next week , with monday 's strike set to go ahead in the meantime .
arriva north west run services across greater manchester , merseyside , lancashire and cheshire .
the company says it has offered 2.6 % from april to october and then 3 % from october to next april , but it could not afford to offer any more .

documents.title: rapist jailed over 1980s attacks on boy , 6
text: a man has been jailed for raping and repeatedly assaulting a six-year-old boy in the 1980s .
gary mottershead attacked the boy several times between 1981 and 1983 .
the 50-year-old was arrested after his crimes were finally reported in 2015 , greater manchester police said .
mottershead , of norris road , sale , was sentenced to six years in prison after he was found guilty of rape and five counts of indecency with a child at manchester 's minshull street crown court .

today 's sentence shows that no matter how long it has been since a sexual offence occurred , we take every report seriously and work tirelessly to ensure those responsible face the consequences of their actions .

documents.title: twelve fined over anti-fracking protest
text: twelve people , including a lancashire county councillor , have been found guilty of obstructing the highway during an anti-fracking protest .
the green party 's gina dowding was one of six women and three men arrested at the cuadrilla site on preston new road on 3 july .
three other women were also reported for summons over the protest .
all 12 were handed a 12-month conditional discharge and a fine of £ 250 at blackpool magistrates court .
they were also ordered to pay a victim surcharge of £ 20 .

documents.title: lancashire woman paralysed after spinal injury helping others 'get through it '
text: a woman from chorley has been speaking about how she stays positive and the work she does with a charity , after a spinal cord injury left her paralysed from the chest down .
laura may was 11 when her spinal cord was pierced during an operation .
now 23 , she now works as a course leader with back up - a charity that helps those affected by spinal cord injury .
i understand that difficulty and i want to reassure people that you can get through it .
it also helps me a lot .
just being able to pass on my skills and think 'oh , i 've come a long way ' is quite a nice reflection .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: anti-fracking protesters found guilty

the green party 's gina dowding was one of six women and three men arrested at the cuadrilla site on preston new road on 3 july .
three other women were also served with a summons over the protest .
they were all handed a 12-month conditional discharge and a fine of £ 250 at blackpool magistrates ' court .

documents.title: mersey gateway bridge rakes in almost £ 50,000 in fines in one week

author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: work on manchester home halted amid 'risk to life '
text: refurbishment work on an end-terrace home in manchester has been halted amid fears of a `` very real risk to life '' .
manchester city council and the health and safety executive stepped in to stop work at the house in honor street , longsight after it emerged renovations were being carried out without permission .
the council was contacted by a resident , and staff found there were `` substantial excavations '' under the property to make a new basement , potentially making the house unstable .
work on a new roof was also being done without permission .
the hse served a prohibition notice , stopping any further work on the property .
the risk to life at this site was very real and we will have no hesitation to intervene with any building that is being refurbished in an unlawful and dangerous way .
building owners need to be mindful of the potential risks associated with inappropriate alterations without guidance from professionals .

documents.title: man left with serious injuries after being hit by car
text: a man was taken to hospital with serious injuries after being hit by a car in a lancashire town , prompting a police appeal for information .
the 34-year-old was on liverpool road in penwortham when he was struck by a red volkswagen golf which had mounted the pavement .
he suffered injuries to his head , neck , face and legs and was taken to the royal preston hospital where he remains in a serious but stable condition .
the driver of the golf , a 76-year-old woman from tarleton , was treated for shock and minor injuries .
police have asked for anyone with information to contact them .

documents.title: radio staff raise over £ 20k during children in need challenge
text: it 's the final day of bbc radio lancashire 's children in need pedal for pudsey challenge , which has seen the team so far raise more than £ 20,000 .
presenters graham and gilly have been attempting to pedal over 100 miles this week in their pudsey mobile .
they have visited schools and businesses on the way along , with pudsey bear , and will finish later at blackpool tower .
the children in need fundraising marathon will peak later with the bbc 's annual television extravaganza .

documents.title: man charged after boy , 16 , dies in 'hit and run '
text: a man has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving after 16-year-old boy died in a suspected hit and run .
thomas edwards died in hospital after he was hit by an audi on mossley hill drive , near sefton park , on monday .
patrick smeda , 34 , from wavertree , has also been charged with failing to stop after and accident , and driving while disqualified and without insurance .
he will appear at liverpool magistrates court .
thomas 's parents paid tribute to him earlier this week , saying he was `` a lovely , polite , caring young man '' .

documents.title: wiggins to make competitive rowing debut
text: sir bradley wiggins is set to make his competitive rowing debut at next month 's british indoor championships .
the 37-year-old from chorley will compete in the 2,000m race at london 's olympic velodrome on saturday , 9 december .
the five-time olympic cycling champion and 2012 tour de france winner retired from cycling in december 2016 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: people given the opportunity to adopt a bee in manchester
text: people in manchester are being given the chance to adopt their very own bee to raise money for charity .
the printworks in manchester , which houses bars , restaurants and a cinema , is currently home to 80,000 honey bees which live on top of the roof .
a small donation will give people the chance to name the bee and a chance to buy the honey they produce , and money raised will go to local charities the booth centre and forever manchester .
the bee has been an emblem of manchester since the victorian era .

documents.title: charging points for electric cars to be installed across lancashire
text: one hundred and fifty charging points for electric vehicles are set to be installed across lancashire .
they will be fitted following a successful in a bid by lancashire county council for £ 14.8m from the department for transport 's highway maintenance challenge fund to invest in new technology .
the funding will also see old street lights replaced with new led ones .
work on the scheme is set to begin next year .
the scheme aims to increase take-up of electric vehicles by ensuring owners can always find somewhere to recharge when making local journeys .

documents.title: football : man city women reach champions league quarter-finals
text: manchester city women reached the quarter-finals of the women 's champions league after beating lsk kvinner 2-1 to progress 7-1 on aggregate .
the visitors , trailing 5-0 from the first leg , took the lead against the run of play when marte berget slid in to turn home emilie haavi 's centre .
izzy christiansen swept in a through ball from nikita parris to equalise just after half-time .
parris met melissa lawley 's low cross to make it 2-1 with 17 minutes left .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: talks to take place to avert further strike action on buses
text: talks will take place in a bid to avert strike action on arriva bus services across the north west .
members of the unite and gmb unions will walk out for nine days next month in a continuing row over pay .
arriva said it was `` keen '' to meet the unions and `` resolve the pay dispute '' .
a unite spokesman said a fresh pay offer was `` an absolute insult '' .
plans for a strike on 4 , 7 , 12 , 13 , 14 , 20 , 21 , 22 and 23 december were announced earlier this week , affecting bus services throughout the region .

documents.title: peter kay announces return to stand up
text: bolton comedian and actor peter kay has announced he will be going on tour again in the uk after eight years off .
the comedian , who recently featured in bbc 's car share , will start his tour in birmingham in april 2018 and end in liverpool in march 2018 .
the tour includes four dates at manchester arena , where he worked as a steward in the 1990s .
in june 2018 .
the 44-year-old currently holds the record for the biggest-selling comedy tour of all time after playing to 1.2 million people in 2010 .

documents.title: virgin west coast rail workers to strike
text: rmt members working on virgin west coast have voted 9-1 to take action , including strike action , over pay .
the union said nearly 1,800 workers , including train managers and on-board catering workers , on the west coast route took part in the ballot .
the route run between london euston and glasgow , and includes services to manchester , liverpool and preston .
the rmt said it wanted a `` suitable and equal '' pay offer to the £ 500 rise given to drivers .
a virgin trains spokesman said they hoped to be able to run most services throughout any industrial action .

documents.title: homelessness prevention centre to open in manchester
text: a former residential care home is to be converted into a 38-bed homelessness prevention centre .
the longfield centre in chorlton will provide temporary accommodation and support services to help people becoem independent and find employment , training and other opportunities .
the centre will be run by manchester city council and will help single people and childless couples .
it will be used by people who are referred by council homelessness services and organisations working with homeless people .
the centre will open in january 2018 .

documents.title: manchester man was listed as is specialist sniper , court hears
text: a british man was listed as a specialist `` sniper '' in official islamic state ( is ) records leaked to a television reporter by a defector , a court heard .
mohammed abdallah , 26 , travelled to syria with help from his brother who set up a `` hub '' of communication at home in manchester , the old bailey was told .
the prosecution said is files said he was a `` fighter '' specialising in using a dushka - a heavy russian machine gun .
mr abdallah denies being a member of is , possessing a gun and receiving £ 2,000 for terrorism purposes .
the trial continues .

documents.title: 'irresponsible behaviour ' causes tram delays
text: services on metrolink were disrupted this afternoon after anti-social behaviour on the east didsbury line .
transport for greater manchester ( tfgm ) said a large group of schoolchilden ran on and off a number of trams before activating an emergency brake which prevented a tram from leaving the stop .
cctv footage is now being reviewed to find out which school the children attended .
danny vaughan , tfgm 's head of metrolink , said : `` we will not tolerate anti-social behaviour or irresponsible acts like this that could compromise the safety of staff and passengers .
tram platforms are not playgrounds . ''
metrolink tweeted that this caused severe delays on services between east didsbury and rochdale .

documents.title: 'sexist ' topless women shoe ad banned
text: a `` sexist '' online shoe advert from a lancashire firm featuring topless women has been banned by the advertising watchdog .
redfoot shoes , which trades as goodwin smith based in bacup , lancashire , ran a campaign that included images of women covering their breasts with shoes .
the advertising standards authority said it was sexist and degrading to women and must not appear again .
goodwin smith said : `` we see the video as a light-hearted fantasy concept for men .
it is certainly not intended to degrade women . ''

documents.title: latest headlines from the north west
text: latest headlines from the north west

documents.title: women wanted over takeaway pizza attack
text: police are searching for two women in connection with an attack on a woman who was kicked and punched while eating a pizza in wigan .
the 21-year-old victim was leaving a takeaway on king street in the early hours of 7 october when she was approached from behind by two women and a man .
on of the women knocked the pizza out of the victim 's hand and she was assaulted before the offenders fled .
police have issued cctv images of two suspects and asked for anyone with information to contact them

documents.title: artist exercises right to drive sheep through salford
text: artist harold riley has celebrated being awarded the freedom of salford by taking up the ancient right the accolade gives to drive a herd of sheep through the city .
the 82-year-old was given the honour for his continuous support of the city and generosity to local and international charities .

about 150 onlookers , including manchester united legends sir alex ferguson and denis law , watched him receive the prestigious award , before he stopped traffic on the a6 with his small herd of four sheep , named alan , albert , forest and bubba gump .

documents.title: syrian family re-homed following suspected arson attack
text: a young syrian family who had to leave their home following a suspected arson attack have been re-homed , st helens council has said .
the man , his heavily pregnant wife , and their three children - aged one , three and six - escaped the house in park avenue , haydock , in the early hours of sunday .

council leader barrie grunewald said : `` we were all sickened to hear of this disgusting attack on a syrian family who came to st helens seeking protection after fleeing conflict in their home country .
the wellbeing of this young family was of the utmost importance and i 'm pleased to hear that such swift action was taken to ensure their safety , and that they have now been resettled . ''
the family suffered smoke inhalation but have now recovered physically as the police keep an `` open mind '' on the attack .

documents.title: former united player denies reports he has asked to leave west ham
text: west ham striker and former manchester united forward javier hernandez has denied suggestions he has asked to leave the premier league club .
reports in his homeland said the 29-year-old mexican wanted to rejoin chivas before next year 's world cup .
hernandez , who joined the hammers from bayer leverkusen for £ 16m in july , said the stories were `` completely false '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: milestone for children in need bike 'n ' busk challenge
text: radio merseyside have reached the 100 mile mark as part of their children in need cycling challenge .
the breakfast show team have been out `` biking and busking '' - that 's cycling and singing - at during a 140-mile cycle to raise cash .
today 's journey sees them travelling from speke to wirral .

documents.title: north west arts organisations awarded funding
text: two arts organisations in the region have been awarded funding as part of the arts council 's `` strategic touring '' programme .

manchester 's quarantine , which produces original theatre , performance and public events , was awarded £ 70,000 as part of the programme which funds touring work , focusing especially on areas where people have low engagement with the arts .
the royal court liverpool trust , which develops education and participation schemes in the city , was awarded £ 135,000 .
we know that not everyone has easy access to arts and culture where they live .
our strategic touring programme funds projects to visit a range of non-traditional venues and spaces to offer people the chance to experience cultural activity in the heart of their communities

documents.title: blackpool star wars fan 's £ 15k toy collection up for sale
text: if you 're a fan of star wars then luke no further - a huge collection of toys is going under the hammer at auction near chippenham .
about 250 items , which belonged to a fan in a galaxy far , far , away in blackpool , are expected to sell for around £ 15,000 .

documents.title: robber threatens salon staff with 'aids ' needle
text: a man threatened staff at a wirral hair salon with a needle and claimed he had aids , before stealing cash and a handbag .
merseyside police described the robbery on tuesday evening on bidston avenue in claughton , birkenhead , as `` a cowardly attack '' .
nobody was injured , and police are searching for the man , who was described as slim and wearing dark clothing with his face covered .

documents.title: five held in manchester dawn drug raids
text: five people were arrested in dawn raids in manchester as part of a crackdown on drugs .
the searches were carried out as part of operation malham , which targets drug dealing in the south of the city .
it follows previous raids last week , with more than 14 properties now searched .
the arrested men , aged between 19 and 54 , were held on sus of supplying class a drugs .
the 19-year-old was also arrested on sus of possession with intent to supply cannabis .
we are dedicated to rooting out those who seek to make profits from putting drugs on our streets .
the arrests have only been made possible through the support of partner agencies and community intelligence .

text: latest headlines from the north west

documents.title: hunt for robbers who left shop staff 'terrified '
text: five men wearing balaclavas and wielding a metal bar burst into a convenience store and threatened staff , leaving them `` terrified '' , police said .
the robbers targeted the mccolls shop in newbrook road , over hulton , on sunday evening , and forced staff to hand over cigarettes and empty cash from the tills into a bag .
the men also emptied the safe before escaping from the back of the shop .
police are asking anyone with information to contact them .

documents.title: cycling : sir bradley wiggins says investigation was 'living hell '
text: sir bradley wiggins said his life was `` a living hell '' during an investigation into allegations of wrongdoing at british cycling and team sky .
on wednesday , uk anti-doping said there would be no charges over a `` mystery '' medical package delivered for wiggins at the criterium du dauphine in 2011 .
chorley based wiggins , 37 , said the investigation `` felt nothing less than a witch hunt '' .
he added : `` being accused of any doping indiscretion is the worst possible thing for any professional sportsman . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: liverpool mayor joe anderson reported for alleged 'sexist ' remark
text: liverpool 's city mayor joe anderson has been reported for allegedly making a sexist '' remark towards a female opposition councillor .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: railway could be revamped amid dock regeneration plans
text: the disused poulton to fleetwood railway line could be reinstated as part of a multi-million plan to regenerate wyre dock .
the ambitious fleetwood quays plans for the dock were revealed last night by wyre dock development at rossall school , to an audience of residents , businesses and other groups .

the scheme has been inspired by chinese culture and heritage and includes a hotel , restaurant , botanical-themed visitor attraction and transport , and hopes to create new jobs in the area and boost the economy .
the town has not had a railway since the 1970s , but the scheme will allow private sector investment to reopen the line .
the next step for the company is to secure planning approval with the aim of starting work in 2019 .

documents.title: artist puts tinder twist on lady chatterley 's lover
text: you 've heard of the famous novel character lady chatterley - but you probably were n't expecting to find her on tinder .
that 's the theme of a new art installation created by an artist who has given the 1928 dh lawrence novel a quirky twist .
libby heaney created a tinder profile for the character , before programming a bot to chat with real men , using only lines from the book .
after around 800 conversations with real romance-seekers , the exchanges form part of an artwork called lady chatterley 's tinderbot .
the conversations will be shown on a screen in an exhibition at the lowry arts centre in salford , as part of the humansbeingdigital exhibition from 18 november .

documents.title: parents pay tribute to 'beautiful son ' killed in crash
text: the family of a 16-year-old boy who was struck and killed by a car in liverpool have paid tribute to their `` lovely , polite , caring '' son .
thomas edwards hot by a black audi at about on mossley hill drive on monday evening .
a 24-year-old man from dingle was arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving .
police have asked for any witnesses to contact them .
his parents mark and sharron have released a statement , saying : `` our beautiful son thomas has been taken away from us far too soon .
our hearts have been shattered into a million pieces .
`` thomas was a lovely , polite , caring young man who was one in a million .
he was a loving brother to his three sisters , we could n't have asked for a better son .
he made us proud every day .
`` we just want to know what happened to our beautiful son .
please , if anyone has seen anything or knows anything then please come forward .
we just need answers and to get justice for our little boy . ''

documents.title: anfield cheapest day out , according to price of football study
text: liverpool is the cheapest day out in men 's top flight football in england according to the bbc 's price of football study .
now in it 's seventh year , the study requested information from 232 clubs across england , wales , scotland , northern ireland and europe .
the results show that a ticket , pie , cup of tea and a programme could cost less than £ 20 at anfield .

however , although the annual study found that 135 clubs out of 190 in england , scotland and wales offer reduced prices for teenagers and young adults , 55 % of the fans polled still said they had stopped going completely or go to fewer games because it was too expensive .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: wirral grooming brothers case review to be kept 'secret '
text: a serious case review into two shop worker brothers who sexually abused nine girls will not be made public .
ilvarasan of wallasey village , wirral , and vinothan rajenthiram , of wigan , were jailed for abusing girls between 2010 and 2016 .
author dr maggie atkinson , of the safeguarding board , said she made the decision to protect a victim 's identity but a report on recommendations from the review would be published soon .
a councillor said it was `` appalling '' to keep the review findings `` secret '' .

documents.title: labour mp ivan lewis investigated after harassment claim
text: labour is investigating one of its mps after it was claimed he had made unwanted sexual advances towards women .
the party said it had received a complaint about bury south mp ivan lewis 's conduct .
it refused to discuss details of the allegation , but said it took all complaints of sexual harassment `` extremely seriously '' .
mr lewis previously denied making any `` non-consensual sexual comments or sexual advances towards women '' .

documents.title: radio stations given freedom of liverpool
text: radio merseyside and radio city have been granted the freedom of liverpool .
the motion to grant the stations the accolade was unanimously agreed at liverpool city council 's full council meeting earlier .
presenters billy butler , linda mcdermott and roger phillips of radio merseyside as well as radio city 's pete price have also been granted council 's citizen of honour award .
radio merseyside is in its 50th year while its commercial rival , radio city , has been broadcasting for 43 years .

documents.title: football : marouane fellaini contract negotiations continuing
text: manchester united are prepared to let marouane fellaini leave for nothing at the end of the season , rather than sell the midfielder in january .
fellaini 's contract expires on 30 june and while united began talks with the belgian over a new deal last season , so far there has been no agreement .
the 29-year-old rejected united 's latest offer in september .
fellaini , who joined united for £ 27m in august 2013 , was then manager david moyes ' first significant signing .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: smelly yellow beach blobs 'were palm oil '
text: a mysterious large yellow blob which washed up on the lancashire coastline recently was palm oil , a council said .
the `` rancid smelling '' fatty substance , weighing about one tonne , was found on beaches at cleveleys , fleetwood , knott end and st annes , wyre council said .
while beaches remain open , the council has advised dog walkers to keep their pets on a lead since the palm oil deposits are `` highly toxic '' to canines .
the council said it was working with other agencies to get rid of the oil .

documents.title: events cancelled after lead stolen from entertainment venue roof
text: lead stolen from the roof of an entertainment venue has led to events being cancelled after the theft caused a leak following heavy rain .
lead flashing was taken from the roof of old station buildings , home to the platform , in morecambe , on monday evening .
emergency repairs are taking place at the lancaster city council-owned site and events on thursday and friday have been cancelled .
the council has urged anyone with information to contact the police .

documents.title: plans submitted for new £ 50m cruise terminal
text: plans for a £ 50m cruise terminal in liverpool have been submitted to the city council .
the proposals by liverpool city council would include the removal of princes jetty and the construction of a suspended deck in the river mersey .
it said the proposed site at princes jetty has been gifted by liverpool waters developer peel .
if planning permission is granted work could start in spring 2018 .
future plans for the site could include a hotel and a 1,700 space multi-storey car park .

documents.title: 'golden opportunity ' for conductor
text: an orchestra conductor has been chosen from 300 candidates to take part in an international competition in spain to support emerging talent .
robert guy , 29 , from wrexham , described december 's 2017 cadaques orchestra international conducting competition as a `` golden opportunity '' .
he overcame childhood deafness , learning the piano at the age of three even though he could not hear properly .
guy helped to set up north east wales sinfonia and is also the director of the university of manchester 's choral programme .

documents.title: 'arson ' attack on refugee family 's home
text: a charity says it is `` appalled '' about a `` horrendous '' suspected arson attack on a young syrian family 's home .
the man , his heavily pregnant wife , and their three children - aged one , three and six - escaped a house at 04:00 on sunday in park avenue , haydock .
refugee action , which is supporting the `` vulnerable '' family , said they had come to the uk in january for protection after fleeing conflict in syria .
merseyside police said it was keeping an open mind about the blaze .

documents.title: 'majority ' of arena attack costs to be paid
text: manchester is expected to be reimbursed by the government for most of the costs associated with the response to the arena attack , the prime minister has said .
the city council has applied for more than £ 17m to cover its and the emergency services costs after the suicide bombing at manchester arena on 22 may in which 22 people were killed .
details of how the money will be paid out will be provided `` by the end of next week '' , theresa may said .
during prime minister 's questions , she told mps she expected the `` majority of funds will be made available '' soon .

documents.title: new directors at morecambe football club
text: morecambe football club has announced the appointment of two new directors .
graham and jordan burnard were voted on to the board of directors .
they directors represent g50 , which owns 82 % of morecambe football club .
in a joint statement they said : `` it is a privilege to be involved in such a wonderful club and we would like to thank all those involved for their continued hard work and support . ''
author: BBC Radio Lancashire
Sport

documents.title: man threatened with gun on way to see girlfriend
text: a 21-year-old man was threatened with a gun on the way to see his girlfriend .
he was taking a shortcut by the junction in grandale street and fleeson street in rusholme , manchester , when a man pulled out a gun on him at about 22:35 yesterday .
the victim managed to run away from the suspect who white and spoke with a local accent .
det insp mark davis said : guns are not welcome on our streets and any threats will be taken extremely seriously . ''
there will be an increased police presence in the area .

documents.title: pedestrian , 16 , hit by car is named
text: a 16-year-old boy who died after being hit by a car has been named .
thomas mark edwards suffered a serious head injury when he was struck by a vehicle in mossley hill drive near sefton park , liverpool , on monday .
he died in hospital .
a 24-year-old man arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving has been released on bail .

documents.title: arriva north west bus staff to take part in nine december strikes
text: arriva north west bus drivers and engineering staff are to take further strike action on nine days in december in a continuing dispute over pay .
members of the unite and gmb unions will walk out on 4 , 7 , 12 , 13 , 14 , 20 , 21 , 22 and 23 december , affecting bus services throughout the region .
a unite spokesman said a fresh pay offer from arriva was `` an absolute insult '' and had been rejected .
arriva said it was `` keen '' to meet the unions and `` resolve the pay dispute '' .

documents.title: 'daily ben nevis walks saved my life '
text: a man who climbed the uk 's highest mountain every day for a month to help tackle his depression says the experience saved his life .
andy cole , a forklift driver from blackpool , took on the challenge after a doctor recommended that being outdoors could boost his mood .
the 40-year-old decided to walk up and down ben nevis for a month .
he has now just completed his challenge .
mr cole said the walks had helped change his perspective on life .

text: the brother of martyn hett , who was killed in the manchester arena bombing , has told bbc 5 live he has received abuse from right-wing extremists .
dan hett is now speaking to students about extremism , in response to broadcaster katie hopkins , who said she was planning a tour of british schools .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: man jailed for nine-and-a-half years for crashing stolen car into cyclist
text: a man who crashed a stolen car into a cyclist in ulverston leaving him with life threatening injuries has been jailed for nine-and-a-half years .
john burns , 30 , from sycamore road in manchester , admitted several charges including blackmail , fraud and causing serious injury by dangerous driving at preston crown court yesterday .
the court heard burn took a vw polo from a woman on 26 july at truckhaven services on the a6 , just off junction 35 of the m6 .
later he was seen driving in hill fall at 50mph on the wrong side of the road when he hit a cyclist , snapping his bike in two and causing serious injuries .
supt rob o'connor said the cyclist `` is making a good recovery , and i wish him all the very best with regards to his ongoing recuperation '' .

documents.title: fire at former waste plastics factory is suspected arson
text: a fire that broke out at a disused waste plastics site is being treated as a suspected arson .
a fire broke out for the fourth time at the disused v10 polymers site in paterson street , blackburn , on monday .
nearby residents were evacuated while about 70 firefighters tackled the blaze .
police are appealing for information to contact them .

we believe this fire was caused deliberately and so if you have any information , or any cctv which you may think could help us with our investigation into this and the previous fires , please get in touch .

documents.title: advice and support for young people with disabilities
text: a one day exhibition aimed at giving advice and support to young people with disabilities is taking place .
kidz to adultz north has been organised by the charity disabled living to provide information for youngsters with disabilities up to the age of 25 and their carers .
there will be support about mobility , funding , seating , beds , employment and accessible vehicles .
kidz to adultz north is taking place at eventcity in manchester from 09:30 to 16:30 tomorrow .

documents.title: liverpool radio stations to be given freedom of the city
text: two radio stations are to be given the freedom of liverpool - the council 's highest civic honour .
radio city and bbc radio merseyside are to be honoured for their contributions to the city and `` diligently reporting '' its highs and lows for decades .
radio merseyside is in its 50th year while its commercial rival , radio city , has been broadcasting for 43 years .
liverpool city council is due to approve the honour at a special council meeting this afternoon .

documents.title: boy suffers fractured skull after 'fight ' broke out
text: a 17-year-old boy has been left with a fractured skull following an attack near a nightclub .
he is thought to have been assaulted following a fight near to the vogue nightclub in hammerton street , burnley , at about 07:00 on sunday .
he was taken to the royal preston hospital and remains in a serious condition .
police are asking anyone with information to contact them .

documents.title: neville defends england performance
text: former england international and united defender phil neville has defended the three lions after fan criticism following the goalless draw with brazil at wembley .
for the second time in five nights , gareth southgate 's inexperienced squad held their own against one of the pre-tournament favourites for next summer 's world cup .

text: it 's day six of radio lancashire 's pedal for pudsey challenge .
presenters graham liver and john gillmore are cycling 120 miles across the county to raise money for children in need , and are being joined by various people along the way , including pudsey bear .
today the team are cycling from blackburn to nelson and are joined by actress , singer and television personality clare sweeney .

documents.title: suffragette garden planned at emmeline pankhurst 's former home
text: a suffragette garden has been planned at the site of the former home of emmeline pankhurst and her daughters .
manchester 's pankhurst trust said the garden at the pankhurst centre in nelson street would pay homage to and mark the centenary of women getting the vote .
it is raising £ 20,000 through a crowdfunding campaign for the project .
work is expected to start on the garden next year .

documents.title: football : united striker becomes belgium 's record goalscorer
text: manchester united striker romelu lukaku became belgium 's record goalscorer as roberto martinez 's side narrowly beat japan 1-0 in brugge .
lukaku , 24 , scored his 31st goal for his country when he headed home nacer chadli 's cross .
lukaku had drawn level with bernard voorhoof and paul van himst on 30 goals last week .
belgium extend their unbeaten run to 15 games , their last defeat coming against spain in a friendly in september 2016 .

documents.title: clean-up continues after major plastics fire in blackburn
text: work to clean up fire debris from a fire at a former plastics recycling plant in blackburn on monday is continuing .
about 12,000 tons of waste was ablaze at the former v10 polymers building in paterson street , which started at about 05:00 and involved more than 70 firefighters .
some residents were evacuated and others told to keep their doors and windows closed after surrounding roads were shut .
fire is now out at the former v10 polymers site .
it 's safe for residents to open windows should you need to .
roads have re-opened apart from mosley street where clean-up of fire debris is ongoing & expected to conclude later this week .
new owner has put 24/7 security on site .

campaigners hoping for a change in the law will meet mps later following a supreme court ruling last year that the legislation had been wrongly interpreted for thirty years .
jordan cunliffe ( was imprisoned for killing garry newlove in warrington in 2008 despite it not being shown that he had struck the fatal blow .
janet cunliffe , whose son jordan was one of three convicted of killing mr newlove , will join others at westminster calling for an independent judicial inquiry .

documents.title: missing mobikes mystery is solved
text: greater manchester 's mobikes have disappeared from the region 's streets during an unannounced period of maintenance .
puzzled cyclists reported being unable to find the distinctive orange-trimmed bikes in recent days .
mobike later confirmed the cycles were removed for upgrades ahead of plans to widen the bike-hire service .
the scheme , backed by manchester and salford councils , launched in june with 1,000 cycles made available .

documents.title: house price 'north-south divide ' narrows
text: house price growth was fastest in the north west of england in the last year , official figures show , as london again recorded the slowest rise .
property prices have sped up in cities such as manchester but the uk average has remained steady , the office for national statistics data shows .
house prices rose by 7.3 % in the year to the end of september in the north west of england .
the uk average was a 5.4 % rise over the same period .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: prison lockdown after explosive found
text: a prison was put on partial lockdown after a potentially explosive device was found .
two wings at hmp risley were searched by police after the discovery at the warrington site on sunday .
the device was dismantled and was not believed to be terrorist-related , cheshire police said .
the force and the ministry of justice are investigating .
the prison service added there was `` no threat to the public or those within the prison '' .

documents.title: metrolink reveals online tool to show 2018 fare hikes
text: metrolink has revealed an online tool to show how much prices will rise from january .
in september , the transport operator said fares would rise by about 6 % but the overall percentage increase will vary between individual tickets .
over the summer customers were asked if they would prefer a gradual three-year increase or a larger one-off rise .
customers choose to spread the cost .
the online tool shows how the new prices will look for all destinations and for single , return and season tickets .

documents.title: the first female premier league referee ?
text: meet yasmin saeed , the 19-year-old aiming to be the first woman to referee in the premier league .
the sport psychology student formerly played for manchester united , crewe alexandra , manchester city and everton before taking up refereeing aged 15 after breaking her pelvis .
she coaches a group of young female referees in manchester and was recently assistant referee for england under-15s v scotland under-15s at st george 's park .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: £ 8m strawberry field refurb plan approved
text: plans to revamp the children 's home immortalised by john lennon in the beatles ' hit strawberry fields have been approved .
the salvation army 's £ 8m scheme for the site , where lennon played as a child , has been rubber-stamped by liverpool city council .
the venture will combine an education centre for young people with learning difficulties and an exhibition on the home , the song and lennon 's early life .
the gates at the site , which is closed to the public , are a popular attraction for beatles ' fans visiting liverpool .
the salvation army said work will start early next year .

documents.title: blackburn a shining example for britain 's high streets
text: retail expert mary portas and other people in the industry are suggesting ways in which to encourage people to head to the high street .
it follows a survey for bbc radio 4 's you and yours which found that in 12 government-funded `` portas pilot '' towns , including nelson , nearly 1,000 shops had disappeared in five years .
last year , blackburn was crowned the `` winner of winners '' in last year 's great british high street awards .
harriet roberts , manager for business improvement district ( bid ) blackburn , put a lot of their success down to changing perceptions through events held in the town centre .

for instance , blackburn has n't settled for the usual christmas lights switch-on ceremony , but instead planned an art installation complete with aerial performances , as well as a lantern parade and festive 'street feast ' .
mary portas said : `` the local council and central government need to decide what type of country we want to live in and intervene to protect social infrastructure '' .

documents.title: man wanted over taxi driver stab attack
text: cctv images have been released of a man police want to speak to in connection with a stabbing in moss side on saturday .
the victim , a 42-year-old taxi driver , was attacked by a passenger in ruskin avenue in a row over a fare .
he remains in hospital but does not have life-threatening injuries , police have said .
we are continuing to follow extensive lines of enquiry and are particularly keen to speak to the man in connection with this attack .

documents.title: uni study could change the way me is diagnosed
text: a study led by the university of central lancashire could change the way chronic fatigue and me is diagnosed .
the research , which has been published in the medical journal bmj open , found ways of diagnosing and treating patients more quickly using a process known as `` the perrin technique '' .
it sees patients assessed around five physical symptoms , including chest and lymph nodes and skin rashes .
patients are currently diagnosed via a process of elimination of other conditions .
there are about 250,000 chronic fatigue and me sufferers in the uk .
the condition causes muscular pain , disabling fatigue and an intolerance to exercise .

documents.title: campaign to house rare silver object in preston museum
text: a preston charity is campaigning to raise funds so that a rare silver object found in lancashire can be housed at the harris museum and art gallery .
a small silver container known as a pyx , from the 1600s , was found in a field near the m61 in lancashire two years ago by a metal detectorist .
the find was reported and declared treasure by the british museum .
now , the friends of the harris charity is campaigning to raise £ 1,250 to buy the object .
it 's believed the item may have been dropped by a priest on his way to take mass as it was found just a few fields away from a known meeting place .

documents.title: police unveil new 4x4 trucks to tackle rural crime
text: lancashire police have acquired three new off-road vehicles to help them combat rural crime .
the liveried 4x4 trucks will give teams better access to rural areas and rough terrain in the county , helping them to crack down on poaching , fuel thefts and organised crime .
the east , west and south divisions have been allocated a truck each .
rural crime can have a huge impact on victims and i continue to fully support the work lancashire constabulary is doing .
protecting our rural communities is as much a priority for me as it is policing our more urban towns and cities .

documents.title: radio favourites continue children in need challenge
text: it 's day five of radio lancashire 's pedal for pudsey challenge .
presenters graham liver and john gillmore are cycling 120 miles across the county to raise money for children in need , and are being joined by various people along the way , including pudsey bear !
today the team are cycling from leyland to whilttle-le-woods and are joined by tv and radio veteran ted robbins .

documents.title: new £ 212m warrington road given green light
text: plans have been approved for a new road route designed to ease congestion in warrington despite protests .
the £ 212m western link road will join the south of the town with great sankey , crossing the manchester ship canal on a high level bridge .
it will go through some residential streets , as well as sankey valley park and morley common recreation area .
warrington borough council said the road was `` essential '' , but campaigners claim it will increase traffic , pollution and noise .

documents.title: house price 'north-south divide ' narrows
text: house price growth was fastest in the north west of england in the last year , official figures show , as london again recorded the slowest rise .
property prices have sped up in cities such as manchester but the uk average has remained steady , the office for national statistics data shows .
house prices rose by 7.3 % in the year to the end of september in the north west of england .
the uk average was a 5.4 % rise over the same period .

documents.title: football : former burnley player sacked by leighton orient
text: national league club leyton orient have sacked head coach steve davis .
the former burnley player and crewe manager , 52 , took charge of the o 's in july following their relegation from league two at the end of last season .
however , the london club have won only five of their 19 league matches in 2017-18 and are 19th in the table , three points above the relegation zone .
ross embleton and dean brill will take charge on an interim basis while a successor is found .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: liverpool metro mayor sets out his vision for the future
text: six months after being elected as metro mayor for liverpool , steve rotheram is to set out his vision for the future of the region later .
mr rotheram has certain powers over issues such as transport and housing for halton and the five merseyside councils .

as part of his vision , he is announcing ten new policy pledges including a promise to build 25,000 new homes before 2022 , a plan to end rough sleeping in the region and a scheme to generate renewable energy from the river mersey .

the simple argument for devolution is that local people who are locally accountable know better than whitehall what our area needs , but it is also about recognising that in an increasingly competitive and changing world , six districts with a population of 1.5 million can be more successful and stronger together .

documents.title: fire crews continue to work at site of recycling plant fire in blackburn yesterday
text: fire crews are expected to remain at the site of a former plastics recycling plant in blackburn throughout the day after yesterday 's serious blaze .
a large fire broke out at the building on paterson street at about 05:00 - the fourth fire in less than three months
about 12,000 tons of waste was ablaze at the former v10 polymers building .
an investigation involving a number of agencies is now under way .
a previous owner is being prosecuted by the environment agency over the management of the site .

documents.title: football : ex-man utd winger to sign deal with vietnamese academy
text: former manchester united winger ryan giggs is set to sign a consultancy deal to become director of football at a vietnamese football academy .
the promotion fund of vietnamese football talents fc said giggs , 43 , will be responsible for coaching players and training coaches .
the two-year deal involves 13-time premier league winner giggs making two trips per year to vietnam .
giggs said in october he was interested in jobs at leicester city and everton .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: liverpool city region mayor to set out plans for the future
text: the mayor of the liverpool city region will set out his vision for the future later with the announcement of ten new policy pledges .
steve rotheram , who was elected six months ago , has powers over issues such as transport and housing for the five merseyside areas and halton in cheshire .
his plans are expected to include generating renewable energy from the mersey , as well as improving the area 's digital connections .
there will also be the promise of 25,000 new homes before 2022 to tackle the region 's housing shortage .

if trains , docks and canals made us the gateway to the first industrial revolution , then world-class connectivity and a plentiful supply of predictable renewable energy can make us the digital gateway to the fourth .

documents.title: department store apologises for describing manchester bee as a wasp
text: department store selfridges has apologised for any offence caused after a ceramic mug covered in manchester bees it was selling online saw the emblem described as a wasp .
the original description showed a of the mug with the caption `` manchester wasps print ceramic mug '' .
the company said there was a copy error online , which had now been corrected , and apologised for any offence caused .
the worker bee has long been an emblem of the city 's industrial past and came to represent unity in the aftermath of the manchester arena attack in may .

documents.title: football : ex-celtic and man utd midfielder in cancer fight
text: former celtic and manchester united midfielder liam miller is having chemotherapy treatment for cancer .
the irishman , 36 , is reportedly on his way back to ireland from the united states .
miller , who won 21 caps for republic of ireland between 2004 and 2009 , started his career at celtic before moving to old trafford .
he also played for leeds united , sunderland , qpr and hibernian before heading to australia .

documents.title: waste plastics site fire 'under control '
text: a fourth fire in less than three months at a former waste plastics site is under control , the fire service said .
about 12,000 tons of waste was alight at the former v10 polymers building in paterson street , blackburn , which started at about 05:00 gmt .

blackburn with darwen council said it was `` frustrated '' by the situation but was working with other agencies to `` minimise the impact '' of the fires , while police said the investigation was `` complex '' .

a director of the former owner of the site is due at blackburn magistrates ' court on tuesday under the environmental permitting regulations 2010 and 2016 , in connection with the operation of waste plastics recycling from the site .

documents.title: trevor sinclair further arrested for assaulting police officer
text: trevor sinclair has been further arrested on sus of a public order offence and assaulting a police officer , the bbc understands .

police said a 44-year-old man from lytham who was arrested on sunday on sus of drink-driving , common assault and criminal damage has been released under investigation on all these offences pending further inquiries .

documents.title: gun amnesty across the region
text: people are being urged to hand in firearms over the next two weeks , as part of a campaign by police across the north west and the rest of england and wales to get guns off the streets .
more than 800 weapons were given up in the north west during last year 's appeal .

documents.title: 'manchester gas man ' spared jail
text: a drug dealer who was caught with over 41,000 nitrous oxide canisters he was selling under the name of `` manchester gas man '' has been spared jail .
a police search of zubair iftikhar 's fallowfield home uncovered the gas , along with business cards , hoodies and bags adorned with his trading name .
the 31-year-old admitted two counts of possession with intent to supply .
he was sentenced to 10 months in prison , suspended for a year at manchester crown court .

documents.title: radio merseyside presenters begin children in need challenge
text: radio merseyside 's `` bike and busk '' challenge is under way .
presenters tony snell , steve coleman and kat macdonald will cycle and sing 140 miles over the next five days .
the team set off this morning from southport to crosby then on to bootle and kirkby on day one of their journey across merseyside for children in need .
liverpool phoenix cc joining us from bootle strand to aintree racecourse ! !
# busk # bbccin

documents.title: extra rail services for manchester
text: more trains are to run between manchester victoria , bolton and blackburn .
northern rail said from the start of next month it will increase the hourly service on weekdays to every 30 minutes .

documents.title: former blackburn player shearer investigates dementia and football
text: former england captain and blackburn rovers forward alan shearer has an mri scan as part of his investigation into whether there is a link between dementia and the regular heading of footballs .
recent scientific reports from around the world have revealed that the link between football and dementia could be a result of brain damage caused by heading the ball .
watch the full documentary , alan shearer : dementia , football and me , on bbc iplayer
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: secret snow-boarding stunt at chill factore
text: three men spent the night secretly snow-boarding at manchester 's chill factore indoor slope , prompting an internal security probe .
the trio hid in the building until it closed and then posted mobile phone footage of their stunt on social media .
but they left behind a £ 5,000 camera which they had used to film the escapade .
managers at the attraction have confirmed they have now started an investigation .

text: four liberal democrat councillors have formed their own party in burnley calling it the burnley and padiham independent party .

documents.title: briton died from 'blast injuries ' in syria
text: a british man killed fighting the so-called islamic state in syria died from blast injuries , an inquest has heard .
luke rutter , 22 , from birkenhead , died on 5 july in raqqa after joining kurdish fighters of the ypg .
an inquest in liverpool heard he was `` more likely than not '' to have been killed by either by an improvised explosive device ( ied ) or a rocket .
a post-mortem examination showed the cause of mr rutter 's death was blast injuries .

documents.title: trevor sinclair in drink-drive arrest
text: pundit and former england footballer trevor sinclair has been arrested on sus of drink-driving , common assault and criminal damage .
the 44-year-old was arrested after a woman was hit by a car , suffering minor injuries .
lancashire police said officers responded at 20:45 gmt on sunday to a disturbance at a home on victory boulevard in lytham .
it said a man had already left the property in a car .

documents.title: traffic lights to be installed on m6-m62 link road
text: traffic lights are to be placed on two busy link roads between the m6 and the eastbound m62 under plans to ease motorway congestion .
testing has begun on the system , near warrington in cheshire , and it will be turned on fully in december , according to highways england .
a spokesman said if the £ 7m trial was successful , it could be rolled out on motorway link roads across the country .
previously , traffic lights have only been installed on motorway slip roads .

documents.title: father 'tried to suffocate baby to repair relationship with partner '
text: a man twice tried to suffocate his baby daughter in a `` warped '' bid to mend his relationship with his partner , a court has heard .
a family court hearing in blackburn heard how the couple 's two oldest children had died as babies .
last year their third child suffered separate `` acute , life-threatening '' episodes at the age of four months .
a judge concluded the father had lied and `` did things to [ his daughter ] that he should not have done '' .

documents.title: cycling : britain win gold in women 's team pursuit in manchester
text: great britain 's katie archibald , elinor barker , emily nelson and neah evans claimed gold in the track cycling world cup in manchester yesterday .
it was archibald and barker 's second gold , having triumphed in saturday 's madison after britain 's men 's team won their team pursuit final .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: man jailed for leaving partner blind in one eye
text: a man who repeatedly attacked his partner leaving her blind in one eye and then offered her up to £ 30,000 to drop the case with police has been jailed .

robert fitzpatrick ( left ) , 45 , assaulted the 29-year-old at a property in blackpool , between 2015 and 2016 where she also suffered a broken wrist and in the final attack was left blind in one eye after being punched repeatedly in the head .
after she reported the assaults to police fitzpatrick and his associate , lee jumeaux , offered her up to £ 30,000 to drop the case but she refused .

at preston crown court on friday , fitzpatrick , of no fixed address , was jailed for 20 years and six months after he admitted grievous bodily harm , actual bodily harm and conspiracy to pervert the course of justice .
jumeaux , 38 , of park road , blackpool , was jailed for two years after being convicted of conspiring to pervert the course of justice .
dc matt hodgson said it was a `` horrific case , adding : the victim has been left with lasting physical damage .
she showed further bravery when she refused to be intimidated into dropping her complaint . ''

documents.title: pedal for pudsey challenge continues
text: it 's day four of bbc radio lancashire presenters graham & gilly 's pedal for pudsey .
today the team are travelling between kirkham and leyland , in their attempt to pedal over 100 miles in a week across the county in their pudsey mobile !
the challenge started on friday morning at the ashton memorial in lancaster and will finish on friday at blackpool tower .

documents.title: arriva bus drivers and engineers strike again over pay
text: passengers are facing more disruption today as more than 2,000 drivers and engineers from arriva bus stage another one day strike over pay .
the only services to run will be some from the company 's chester depot .
gmb and unite union members are on their sixth day of strike action in the past two months .
there will be two more one-day walkouts later this month .

documents.title: people urged to hand in firearms during gun amnesty
text: people are being urged to hand in firearms as a two-week gun amnesty gets under way across the north west today .
more than 800 firearms were handed in , in the region during last year 's amnesty .
in merseyside , five people have been killed and 42 injured by guns in the last 13 months .
this year 's appeal is being supported by the father of halton mccollin , who was shot dead in a case of mistaken identity in greater manchester , nine years ago .

documents.title: work continues to extinguish fire at former waste plastics site
text: firefighters are continuing to work to put out a huge fire at the former v10 polymers site in blackburn .
the number of fire crews dealing with the blaze , which started at the waste plastics site in paterson street at about 05:00 , had been reduced a short time ago .
residents have been told to keep their doors and windows closed as a precaution .
the cause of the blaze is yet to be confirmed and firefighters are expected to be at the site for most of the day .

documents.title: tyson fury 'to return to the ring in 2018 '
text: former heavyweight champion tyson fury will return to the ring in 2018 , according to his uncle and trainer peter fury .
the morecambe-based boxer , who has not fought since beating wladimir klitschko in november 2015 , is suspended for a doping violation and awaiting a hearing by uk anti-doping .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: blackpool-preston trains temporarily closed for rail electrification work
text: trains are not running between preston to blackpool until the end of january as the line has closed for electrification work .
the 17-mile route is being electrified and work has started at blackpool north and kirkham and wesham stations during the closure , with blackpool north shut until march .
the work is part of the £ 1bn great north rail project to upgrade links across northern england by 2022 .
bus replacement services will be in operation as construction continues .

documents.title: council unveils plans for budget cuts
text: cheshire east council is to give more details today on how it will fill a £ 70m funding gap over the next three years .
five libraries in the north of the borough could be transferred to a charity that also runs local leisure centres .
respite care services at lincoln house in crewe and mountview in congleton could also cease , under the plans .
demand for adult social care is adding more than £ 50m of extra costs , the council said .
author: Phil McCann
Cheshire Political Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: blackburn residents told to keep windows and doors shut because of fire
text: residents in blackburn are being told to keep their windows and doors shut whilst firefighters continue to put out a fire at a former waste plastics site .
the number of fire engines at the paterson street building has been reduced from 12 to eight , and some roads in the surrounding area remain closed as a precaution .
the fire broke out about 05:00 this morning and is the fourth fire at the site in less than three months .
we reducing the number of fire engines at the scene in blackburn fire to eight .
whilst the smoke plume has reduced , people close to the scene should keep windows and doors shut .

documents.title: drone footage shows extent of fire in blackburn
text: drone footage shows the extent of a huge fire at the former v10 polymers site in blackburn .
firefighters were called to paterson street just after 05:00 this morning and are currently working to put the fire out .
it is the fourth fire at the site in less than three months .
a handful of residents have been evacuated for their safety and surrounding roads have been closed .

documents.title: search for man who stabbed manchester taxi driver continues
text: police are continuing to search for a man who repeatedly stabbed a taxi driver after a row over a fare in manchester .
officers found the 42-year-old victim with serious injuries in moss side , manchester after 20:10 on saturday .
his passenger , who had been dropped off in ruskin avenue , had attacked him before running away , police said .
the driver 's condition is not believed to be life-threatening .
the offender is described as a slim white man in his 20s with dark hair and was wearing a black coat with a black hoodie underneath , police said .

documents.title: fourth fire at v10 polymers plastics in blackburn
text: firefighters are dealing with a fourth fire at former waste plastics site .
the fire at the former v10 polymers building in paterson street , blackburn , started at about 05:00 , lancashire fire and rescue service said .
a `` handful '' of residents in the area have been evacuated as a precaution and some nearby roads are closed .
a fire first broke out at the site on 21 august , followed by a major blaze major fire at the same location on 28 september and a third on 8 october .
